bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 23, 1945

div1.p: Siler informs Hench that he was elected to the board of the Walter Reed Memorial Association at its annual meeting.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, November 23, 1945
div1.opener:
accepted Dec 9 1945
THE PRESIDENT
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, N.W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
November 23, 1945
Col. Philip S. Hench, Med. Corps, A. U. S.,
Army & Navy General Hospital
Hot Springs, Arkansas
My dear Colonel Hench:
div1.p:
It give me very great pleasure to advise you that at the annual
meeting of the Board of Managers of the Walter Reed Memorial Association
on November 19, 1945, you were elected a member of this Board, vice Colonel
Julian M. Cabell, deceased.

Very shortly, I will send you copies of the minutes of the last
two annual meetings in order that you may become conversant with some of the
matters that come before the Board.

General Kean informs me that you expect to be in Washington
about December 5th and we are looking forward to seeing you at that time.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Colonel, U. S. Army (Retired)
Secretary
Walter Reed Memorial Association jfsk
